item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Thursday, November 21, 2024 at 11:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. TIL: Some surprising code execution sources in bash (36 points | 7 comments)
2. Why I stopped using OpenBSD (55 points | 27 comments)
3. They all use it (33 points | 80 comments)
4. Async/Await Is Real And Can Hurt You (34 points | 73 comments)
5. AAA - Analytical Anti-Aliasing (52 points | 6 comments)
6. BEAM's bright future with Gleam (and JavaScript?) (4 points | no comments)
7. DBSP: Automatic Incremental View Maintenance for Rich Query Languages (9 points | 5 comments)
8. Let’s Encrypt: Ten Years (42 points | 39 comments)
9. Sequin: a tool for inspecting ANSI sequences (19 points | 1 comment)
10. Delta Chat introduces realtime Peer-to-Peer networking (16 points | no comments)
11. Where’s _why? What Happened When One of the World’s Most Beloved Programmers Vanished (2012) (6 points | no comments)
12. Native compilation of Prolog predicates with Cranelift (9 points | 2 comments)
13. Map Keys and Lifetimes (17 points | 1 comment)
14. Does the internet route around damage? - Baltic sea cable cuts (19 points | no comments)
15. FireDucks : Pandas but 100x faster (13 points | 7 comments)
16. Rust Foundation Collaborates With AWS Initiative to Verify Rust Standard Libraries (6 points | 1 comment)
17. Fargate vs EC2 (9 points | 3 comments)
18. Modern Hardware for Future Databases (5 points | no comments)
19. Building a Large Geospatial Model to Achieve Spatial Intelligence (3 points | no comments)
20. SQL, Homomorphisms and Constraint Satisfaction Problems (10 points | 1 comment)
21. United States of America vs. Google LLC (0 points | no comments)
22. Lush: my favorite small programming language (31 points | 3 comments)
23. GNU Artanis 1.0.0 released (1 points | no comments)
24. FreeBee, an AT&T UNIX PC emulator (9 points | 1 comment)
25. GHC's WebAssembly backend now supports Template Haskell and GHCi (1 points | no comments)
